item.description:
We all know there are a few truths in this world, certainties or axioms that we can all agree on. For example, there’s (the idiomatic) “you can’t get blood from a stone,” or “money doesn’t grow on trees;” there's (the metaphysic) “Truth exists, only falsehood has to be invented;” and (the cinematic) “stupid is as stupid does,” or “never go in against a Sicilian when death is on the line."

 

 

But I’m not here to talk about any of these; I’m here to talk about this one: A body at rest will remain at rest unless acted upon by an unbalanced external force. Sound familiar?? A little too familiar?? That’s Newton’s 1st Law of Motion (part of it anyway) - more Law of Nature than axiom.

Well, I’m here to say that I am that unbalanced force, a force meant to… a force that's meant to rouse you from your...

Ok, wait a minute... I'm here to say, that this hike is that unbalanced force, a force meant to rouse you from your slumber, to peel you off your couch and encourage you to join us for an afternoon hike along the Wapack Trail, a trail which connects the summits of North Pack and Pack Monadnock mountains, connects overlook with overlook, you with your spirit (and nature), and indirectly connects us to a pretty darn cool pub down the street (if by chance, that means anything to you).

 

About The Hike
(trail map)

It all begins at 9 AM, at Miller State Park as we head north along the Wapack Trail. We'll climb "up" until we summit Pack Mondanock, but no further. In fact, we'll have no choice - one of those "Law of Nature" things. Here we'll either lament our inablity to "climb" higher, or celebrate the views afforded us by a fire tower and various overlooks. We'll then continue northward, hiking thru a "most" beautiful pine forest, on the way to the summit of North Pack Monadnock. After lunching, we’ll head back to our cars, walk thru that "most" beautiful pine forest again, re-summit Pack Monadnock, and hike down the very trail we hiked up… and should we decide, drive to Harlow's Pub for some brews and stews.

With all this in mind, it is very important to be prepared for changes in temperature and weather, strong cold winds, icy & rocky trails… and should we go to Harlow's, cold brews and warm stews. Please, dress in layers, have a wind/rain jacket available, and bring plenty of insulation, food, water and something warm to drink.

Note: This is a 7 1/2 mile hike w/ several steep sections. Should there be snow or ice on the trail, MICROspikes or similar traction devices will be required. We'll also be hiking at a steady moderate pace, and should there be any severe weather, this event will be canceled.


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cold Weather/Winter Essentials (required):
• Synthetic or Wool Wicking Underpant & Undershirt
• Mid-layer Synthetic or Wool Insulating Pant & Shirt
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket and/or Vest
• Windproof/Waterproof Shell w/hood & Pant
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks (insulating layer)
• Sturdy Hiking Boots (waterproof)
• Hat & Gloves
• Extra Insulating Layers (pant & top)
• Extra pair of Socks, Hat & Gloves
• Water (min. 2L) - in a wide-mouthed bottle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries)
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's no reason not to carry one)
• MICROspikes or similar traction devices (not Yaktrax)

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies
• Hand Warmers
• Balaclava
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries
• Trekking Poles (very helpful when using snowshoes)
• Gaiters
• Goggles
• Sleeping Pad
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter/Bivy
• Camera/Binoculars

IMPORTANT: NO JEANS, NO SNEAKERS, NO COTTON CLOTHING. They get wet, They stay wet & They won’t keep you warm.
Also, Let's not underestimate anything, come prepared for cold cold temps., wet weather, early darkness and lots of wind.

 

 

Directions:
From Leominster & Rt 2 West, take Exit 31B. Follow Rt 12 North to Fitchburg, turning right on Rt 31 North. Follow Rt 31 to Greenville, NH and bear left onto NH Rt 45 North, follow to Rt 101. Turn Left onto NH 101 West and drive approx. 2 miles before turning right into Miller State Park.

Google maps: http://maps.google.com/maps...

Coordinates: 42.8490, -71.8875

 

Additional Information:

Distance: approx. 7 1/2 miles
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 2400 ft
Exposure: minimal along Cliff Trail

Difficulty: Moderate
Pace: Moderate
Approx. Hike Time (including stops): 6:00+ hrs

Sunrise: 7:16 a.m.
Sunset: 4:18 p.m.

Approx. Temp. Hi: low 30’s
Approx. Temp. Lo: low 20’s

5-Day Weather.com Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/5-day/USNH0183

6-Day Mountain-Forecast.com Outlook:
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/North-Pack-Monadnock/forecasts/694
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Pack-Monadnock/forecasts/698

Mt. Monadnock/Franklin Pierce Web Cam:
http://www.franklinpierce.edu/webcam_monadnock/

Dublin, NH Web Cam:
http://www.almanac.com/webcam


Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From Leominster, MA & Rt 2 West, take Exit 31B. Follow Rt 12 north, turn right on Rt 31 North. Bear left @ Rt 45 North follow to Rt 101. Turn left & head west, drive approx. 2 miles, MSP is on the right; Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Pack & North Pack... Monadnock
